contract.description: The contract address and chain id

functionName.description: The name of the function you want to call

abi.description: The contract ABI. Has to be in human readable single string format containing the signature of the function you want to call. See https://docs.ethers.org/v5/api/utils/abi/formats/#abi-formats--human-readable-abi for more info

params.description: The parameters to pass to the function. Must be exactly matching the function arguments. You *must* pass in the `:userAddress` parameter to represent the decrypter address. Any array or tuple arguments, must be stringified JSON arrays.

comparison.description: The comparison operator to use. In case of boolean functions you can only use EQUAL or NOT_EQUAL

value.description: The comparison value. Accepts 'true', 'false' or a number

decimals.description: The number of decimals of the asset.

value.description: The amount in the smallest unit of the given asset (e.g. wei for ETH).

Amount.description: An amount of a specific asset.

EncryptableDateTime.description: An encrypted value or its decrypted version.

EncryptableGeoURI.description: An encrypted value or its decrypted version.

anyOf.description: The content for the publication as markdown.

EncryptableMarkdown.description: An encrypted value or its decrypted version.

EncryptableString.description: An encrypted value or its decrypted version.

EncryptableUri.description: An encrypted value or its decrypted version.

GeoURI.description: A Geographic coordinate as subset of Geo URI (RFC 5870). Currently only supports the `geo:lat,lng` format.

Locale.description: A Locale Identifier in the `[language]` OR `[language]-[region]` format (e.g. `en`, `en-GB`, `it`). [language] MUST be in the ISO 639-1 format. [region], if provided, MUST be in the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

attributes.description: A bag of attributes that can be used to store any kind of metadata that is not currently supported by the standard.

type.description: The mime type of the audio file.

duration.description: How long the the audio is in seconds.

recordLabel.description: The record label for the audio.

attributes.description: A bag of attributes that can be used to store any kind of metadata that is not currently supported by the standard.

type.description: The mime type of the image

attributes.description: A bag of attributes that can be used to store any kind of metadata that is not currently supported by the standard.

type.description: The mime type of the video

duration.description: How long the the video is in seconds

value.description: A JS boolean value serialized as string. It's consumer responsibility to parse it.
A valid ISO 8601 date string.  It's consumer responsibility to parse it.
A valid JS number serialized as string. It's consumer responsibility to parse it.
A JSON string. It's consumer responsibility to validate and parse it.

MetadataId.description: A unique identifier that in storages like IPFS ensures the uniqueness of the metadata URI. Use a UUID if unsure.

NetworkAddress.description: An EVM compatible address on a specific chain.

tokenIds.description: A list of token IDs you want to check ownership of. The list is optional for ERC721, you MUST provide a list of token IDs for ERC1155.

formatted.description: The full mailing address formatted for display.

streetAddress.description: The street address including house number, street name, P.O. Box, apartment or unit number and extended multi-line address information.

encryptedPaths.description: An encrypted path is a string of keys separated by . that describe a path to a value in a JSON object (e.g. lens.attachments.0.item.url, lens.content).

anyOf.description: Publication encryption strategy powered by the LIT Protocol.

Signature.description: A cryptographic signature of the Lens metadata.

anyOf.description: A human-readable description of the item. It could be plain text or markdown.

description.description: A human-readable description of the item. It could be plain text or markdown.

anyOf.description: This is the URL that will appear below the asset's image on OpenSea and others etc. and will allow users to leave OpenSea and view the item on the site.

external_url.description: This is the URL that will appear below the asset's image on OpenSea and others etc. and will allow users to leave OpenSea and view the item on the site.

attributes.description: These are the attributes for the item, which will show up on the OpenSea and others NFT trading websites on the item.

anyOf.description: Marketplaces will store any NFT image here.

image.description: Marketplaces will store any NFT image here.

anyOf.description: A URL to a multi-media attachment for the item. The file extensions GLTF, GLB, WEBM, MP4, M4V, OGV, and OGG are supported, along with the audio-only extensions MP3, WAV, and OGA. Animation_url also supports HTML pages, allowing you to build rich experiences and interactive NFTs using JavaScript canvas, WebGL, and more. Scripts and relative paths within the HTML page are now supported. However, access to browser extensions is not supported.

animation_url.description: A URL to a multi-media attachment for the item. The file extensions GLTF, GLB, WEBM, MP4, M4V, OGV, and OGG are supported, along with the audio-only extensions MP3, WAV, and OGA. Animation_url also supports HTML pages, allowing you to build rich experiences and interactive NFTs using JavaScript canvas, WebGL, and more. Scripts and relative paths within the HTML page are now supported. However, access to browser extensions is not supported.

anyOf.description: A virtual location.
The event location (free form text).

position.description: The geographic position of the event.

timezoneId.description: Indicates a reference timezone for the event start and end times. If physical event, you could use the timezone of the event location. If virtual event, the timezone of the event organizer.

timezoneOffset.description: Indicates the reference timezone offset with respect to UTC timezone a the time of event creation. The difference in minutes between the reference timezone time and UTC time (e.g. UTC+2 would be -120, UTC-5 would be 300, UTC would be 0).

schedulingAdjustments.description: Captures extra criteria to recompute correctly future start and end times.See: https://www.w3.org/International/wiki/WorkingWithTimeZones#Working_with_Future_and_Recurring_Events

playbackUrl.description: Some livestream platforms have the playback url as a separate url. If not your case make sure `liveUrl` and `playbackUrl` are the same.

liveUrl.description: Some livestream platforms have the live url as a separate url. If not your case make sure `liveUrl` and `playbackUrl` are the same.

checkLiveAPI.description: The data cannot be changed so you can put in an API endpoint to know if it is still live or not for clients to be able to check.

mintLink.description: The mint item it can be a URL of the known provider like opensea https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0xfaa2471e93bd1cee3b0ab381c242ada8e1d1a759/299 or https://zora.co/collect/0x9d90669665607f08005cae4a7098143f554c59ef/39626. The Lens API has an allow list of providers and if the domain does not match it will mark it as failed metadata

animation_url.description: A URL to a multi-media attachment for the item. The file extensions GLTF, GLB, WEBM, MP4, M4V, OGV, and OGG are supported, along with the audio-only extensions MP3, WAV, and OGA. Animation_url also supports HTML pages, allowing you to build rich experiences and interactive NFTs using JavaScript canvas, WebGL, and more. Scripts and relative paths within the HTML page are now supported. However, access to browser extensions is not supported.

signature.description: A cryptographic signature of the Lens metadata.

appId.description: The App Id that this publication belongs to.

hideFromFeed.description: Determine if the publication should not be shown in any feed.

attributes.description: A bag of attributes that can be used to store any kind of metadata that is not currently supported by the standard. Over time, common attributes will be added to the standard and their usage as arbitrary attributes will be discouraged.

mainContentFocus.description: The main focus of the post.

anyOf.description: A human-readable description of the item. It could be plain text or markdown.

description.description: A human-readable description of the item. It could be plain text or markdown.

anyOf.description: This is the URL that will appear below the asset's image on OpenSea and others etc. and will allow users to leave OpenSea and view the item on the site.

external_url.description: This is the URL that will appear below the asset's image on OpenSea and others etc. and will allow users to leave OpenSea and view the item on the site.

attributes.description: These are the attributes for the item, which will show up on the OpenSea and others NFT trading websites on the item.

anyOf.description: Marketplaces will store any NFT image here.

image.description: Marketplaces will store any NFT image here.

uri.description: The URI of the 3D asset zip file.

zipPath.description: Path in extracted zip. Relative. 3D start point, MUST be 3D file type.

playerUrl.description: The URL of the recommended web based 3D player to use to view the 3D asset.

license.description: The license regulating the use of the 3D asset.

id.description: A unique identifier that in storages like IPFS ensures the uniqueness of the metadata URI. Use a UUID if unsure.

attributes.description: A bag of attributes that can be used to store any kind of metadata that is not currently supported by the standard. Over time, common attributes will be added to the standard and their usage as arbitrary attributes will be discouraged.

appId.description: The App Id that this Account data refers to. If omitted the data is considered to be the global Account data.

signature.description: A cryptographic signature of the Lens metadata.

title.description: The human-friendly title for the module.

description.description: Markdown formatted description of the module.

initializeCalldataABI.description: The Solidity JSON ABI as JSON-string describing the initialization function calldata.

initializeResultDataABI.description: The Solidity JSON ABI as JSON-string describing the initialization result data.

processCalldataABI.description: The Solidity JSON ABI as JSON-string describing the process function calldata.

attributes.description: An arbitrary bag of attributes.

description.description: An optional short and detailed description of the app, explaining its features and purpose.

logo.description: The Logo icon for the app.

platforms.description: The platforms supported by the app.

termsOfService.description: The terms of service for the app.

privacyPolicy.description: The privacy policy for the app.

signature.description: A cryptographic signature of the Lens metadata.

title.description: The human-friendly title for the graph.

description.description: Optional markdown formatted description of the graph.

title.description: The human-friendly title for the Feed.

description.description: Optional markdown formatted description of the Feed.

signature.description: A cryptographic signature of the Lens metadata.

description.description: Optional markdown formatted description of the Community.

icon.description: Optional uri of the Community's icon.

signature.description: A cryptographic signature of the Lens metadata.

description.description: An optional description of the Username collection.

signature.description: A cryptographic signature of the Lens metadata.

description.description: The description of the contract.

image.description: A URI pointing to a resource with mime type image/* that represents the contract, typically displayed as a profile picture for the contract.

banner_image.description: A URI pointing to a resource with mime type image/* that represents the contract, displayed as a banner image for the contract.

featured_image.description: A URI pointing to a resource with mime type image/* that represents the featured image for the contract, typically used for a highlight section.

external_link.description: The external link of the contract.

collaborators.description: An array of Ethereum addresses representing collaborators (authorized editors) of the contract.

description.description: An optional description of the Username collection.

signature.description: A cryptographic signature of the Lens metadata.
